content:
ry 13
												Used to be an excellent, fast-paced MMOFPS. But as time has gone on, most of the enjoyable elements have been stripped out and replaced with extremely simplified and bland systems, while the fast pace has been slowed to a crawl (Most likely to facilitate the paid-purchase Vehicles and Gliders). Performance and stability has gotten progressively worse as well.Some examples of what to expect from modern Firefall:-Lengthy cooldowns on all abilities and usable items. Previously, abilities could be given deployment charges, so that they could be used multiple times before recharge. This is gone.-Alt Fires have been removed from all weapons in favour of Iron Sights. Including the flamethrower. A Flamethrower. With Iron Sights.-Buildings sometimes fail to load entirely after a death and respawn. Previously an extremely rare issue, now more frequent.

												Firefall is surprisingly good. It is very similar to the Boderlands titles or the Oblivion MMO.  I have checked out a lot of MMOs and this one is a real gem. Best of all, even though it is free-to-play, it is not pay-to-win. If you want to put in the time grinding research and materials, you can craft all sorts of super-powerful weapons and mods. PvP is a bit of a disappointment:  huge sandboxes where you need a large squad of friends to survive for long....solo players are just sniper fodder or gang-attack fodder. content:

												JAN 2016 update:So after a year of no updates, they have completely changed the game again. Up until December 2015 it was actually looking promising. Then they decided to ♥♥♥♥ up everything again, because apparently the devs can't go more than 6 months without changing everything. They removed all the weapon alt-fire modes just to slap on ADS on everything and turned down the run speed so the game is slow as hell. All the passive perks that made the frames different were removed because they were too confusing? What the ♥♥♥♥ Red 5?  Firefall was a promising massive open world shooter with arena PvP, now it is just a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ crafting/economy based MMORPG with no PvP. Another game killed by its developers. It seems they fixed most of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t! No more gear breaking permanently, crafting and resources have been simplified, and although it not Arena PvP there is Open World PvP in the game now.Biggest issue right now that I see is inventory slots. I had 700+ items in my inventory since the last time I played last summer/fall. The item cap is at 155, so the first hour or so I was just salvaging junk to get under the cap so my character could move, and I spent all the Red Beans (ingame currency) I had left on buying item slots to get up to 235. Having the cap start at 200 and go up by 25 at same prices would be better.

												This game failed to keep me interested. The initial story cutscene was alright, but after that I was thrust into a world where I had no idea what I was doing. Mind, I was using a controller... but any other shooter game where I've connected a controller, console or otherwise, the controls have all been the same. Firefall completely changed the majority of those controls, and I had no idea what I was doing half the time.On top of that, I didn't even need to do anything. In the first mission, I was just standing at the spawn point trying to figure out the options menu while everyone else murdered all the NPC enemies. I closed the options menu when I heard that the first objective had been cleared, because I wanted to actually contribute. But I felt like I wasn't; there were no less than 20 people shooting with me, so it felt like anything I was doing was pointless.Yes, this is a biased review because I played Destiny just a couple of weeks ago. I'm buying Destiny and deleting Firefall. I would suggest the same for everyone else.

												Overall a good game, worth a try. An interesting mix of FPS/TPS and MMORPG.Pros:+ Decent voice acting.+ Good variety of classes/Battleframes to choose. You get 5 basic Battleframes, that you can change at any time to suit your playstyle and additional 11 Battleframes, that you can unlock later.+ Very large maps, with a lot of quests and dynamic quests that apear randomly. (world bosses, invasions, etc.)+ Good gunplay combined with the skills of the Battleframe.Cons:- Quests are very similar to each other, for example: go to point A, kill some dudes or scan some trash, then go to point B, then kill some more dudes or scan some more trash, then go back to the questgiver. The Only quests that stand out are some story missions and dungeons/ instances.- Leveling up Battleframes takes a long time.- Large amount of bugs and glitches, which range from graphical bugs, sound bugs and even some nasty gameplay bugs. Restarting the game helps with most of these bugs, but still it's not great.

content:
ry 14, 2015
												Note: Steam achievements are rather annoying, unlocked several achievements at once due to being a previous player before steam version came out (only after one achievement was unlocked that i did not have and then all achievements previously unlocked have unlocked)Been a player since the Closed beta, they have seriously come a long way and some of it is not for the better of the game...They have revamped the resources almost 4 different times in the game, changed up the Crafting three seperate times, changed up leveling the frames twice, and changed PVP/PVE functions about twice as well (PVP more than PVE).The game is heavily based around skill of the player with a hint of luck with the gear related, so long as you keep moving you generally will survive most conflicts against the Chosen and the creatures of the world. There is a very diverse variaty of Weapons and Frames to choose from ranging from the classic Archtypes as followsAssault: General class has abilities that can be both used for close combat and long range, your basic build types but branches out into some more exclusive types for Heavier damage or crowd controlDreadnaught: Heavy Class, your massive brick wall that can just take everything and everyone at once and still keep on going, has rapid fire weapons and shield type abilities, branches off into classes that can create shields, become walking armories, or just straight up bullet spitter.Recon: Long range support type class, does have some close combat capabilities but eventually branches out into a long range support class that can be utterly devistating to anything, can cloak itself with certain abilities and even create havoc against the enemy targets by making them attack clones or other enemy troops. Branches off into Heavier sniper type frames armed with Bolt action rifles or charged energy riflesMedic: Healer class, starts off very slow and rather hard to level unless you have some friends but after a while it can branch off to become a very self sufficient frame. Can revive faster than any other class and has abilities to poison and even set some traps if players know what they are doing. Branches off to become a strong healing frame or a more offensive DPS frameEngineer: The Supporter class, can create anything and everything that has a gun attached to it really, can create support turrets, landmines, knockback weapons, and stations that give ammo/health/armor and boosters for damage. Can branch off into a stronger defensive class with more turrets and supportive drops, or an offensive buffer that can boost friendlies weapons and use a railgun.Overall there are quite a few combinations in the end, the game is fun and players who have been around enjoy it and oddly enough still come back to see what else is new with the game...8.5 out of 10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
16, 2015
												before this was a Steam game - i had almost 300 hours in this game. i am a founder. i bought (real $) into this game back when it was an idea. i followed it. i wanted it to succeed. and, to a point, it has. as someone who knows what is missing, and have seen it in the past, i feel this game lacks that. (namely Arena PvP and JETBALL, the Tech Tree, and meaningful professions) but that is all in the past (bitter as i am) taking the game alone, how it is now, is totally a different game. and not in a bad way. just different. all change has good and sour notes. ill start with the bad, only so i can end on the good..bad:still no real PvP worth doing. the 'open world PVP' is basically 'he who has the biggest gun wins' and no real skill curve.the player market is useless. no reason to sell, and because of that, nothing to buy there. it feels like its a solo expiernce. re-grinding out the higher frames (Firecat, Mamoth, Arsinal, .....) feels like too much as you need to do the grind first just to unlock them. there should be alternatives to griding for advanced battle frames. (flat progression was better in the past..)most fight feel too easy. i can bullet sponge most of it and not feel really challanged. i remember a time when the Chosen whould DESTROY you if they found you alone. they where scary. now - a few good hits with my thermal cannon - Dead. and they dont hit very hard any more. the same could be said for the PvE mobs like the Tienkin or the roaming animals.the good:the combat is VERY fluid. the controls play well for the game type. it mixes MMO/fantacy gameplay well with FPS speed and hip-shooting so well its REALLY hard not to have a lot of fun.the squad system has gotten better, and it makes playing in groups with friends or strangers much more fun.the research tree gives a valid reason to sink time into progressing your frames and getting more gear. my only complaint here is that we should specialize. make it meaningful that i maxed out something, so i could sell it on the market and make credits. or else i could do it all myself, and avoid the market all together (that is the corrent meta)im missing some points, but in the end, the game is still fun. i still like the game (though not the same as i used to) if i didnt complain, it whould mean i didnt like it, and didnt care. i only get mad because i do care ,adn i want this game to be successful.

content:
er 26, 2014
												The game itself is great. There are pretty nice encounters and dungeons with fine voice acting that i liked. Bosses are fun to kill and PvP is also enjoyable.. Shooting MMO is something kinda new and this one is from the better ones... BUT... The loot policy in this game is TOTALY wrong. Imagine 10 hours raid in WoW with nothing but green drops. Yes, thats Firefall. They try to slow down players progression that much, that is unacceptable. The fact that shooting game isn't for relaxing (like WoW mainly is), it makes raiding more fun, but you also feel more tired after an hour raid for example... And if you find totaly nothing (No DKP / token system) from that raid.. i really mean NOTHING.. you are pretty disappointed and you feel like you wasted your hour. Every single patch they do follows this loot policy... like a week ago they added a new patch with new dungeon. It was fun to play, again.. i enjoyed it. The dungeon run took me around 40 minutes with other players and guess what i got from the last boss as only reward? Green item. Thats it, 40 minutes wasted, i don't want to do that again.Raid timers reset at wednesday, people usually login just to do time-locked raids (where you have like 10% to get 1 purple item, which is the biggest chance you get in this game) but today, there was like 10 people wanting to raid in the whole EU server. After the last patch, where devs promised "changes to loot system" but players still got screwed, most of them just left the game...The game is dead, no playerbase and im leaving too. Great game killed by series of bad decisions and horrible loot system.

content:
0, 2015
												Why do I reccommend this game?-Great visuals-Fun exploration-Nice class customization and freedom to swap between them.-Battling for territory against NPC's (Even though it may be a small feature)-varying scales of battles with NPC's during events, may require you to work together with others-Great game to play while listening to podcasts.What I (and you might also) dislike about this game:-Repetitive missions-Needs to give more incentive to us players so that we will WANT to max out our reputation with other factions and complete repetitive missions and events.OVERALL, its a nice game that I would play while listening to a podcast or at a time where I just feel the need to get a quick game in to blow off some steam after a bad day. If you plan on dedicating a good amount of your time, and money, to this game I suggest joining up with an "Army" and making a few friends that you can run around and have fun with ingame as it seems that this is the type of game that can quickly turn into a boring chore.I SUGGEST the developers look at updating the game with things such as adding more diverse missions and events, maybe even player specific events, perhaps have more interaction between the player and the various factions to give more incentive to gaining their trust, or even allow the player to choose to gain the trust of the more evil factions. Anything to get rid of the repetitivenness currently plagueing the game, lest it divulge into a themepark MMO.If I had to score this game, I would give it a 5/10. It's your average Free to Play MMORPG.

content:
er 29, 2014
												This game feels in every way like an upgrade to Global Agenda, which could be good or bad depending on your thoughts about GA.  People who do not know any better will liken Firefall to Borderlands or Team Fortress 2, but this is really inaccurate since the design of those two games is so basic by comparison.The world is open and explorable via jetpack, which speaks to the kind of player that I am since I absolutely love the exploration aspect of big games.  The combat is repetitive at times superficially, since that is how FPS games work (even though I play mostly in third person), but it never seems to get stale to me since you have variety in how you level.  You only need to create one character since you switch classes as needed, like in Final Fantasy XIV:  A Realm Reborn, which is a feature that I wish more developers using a class system in game would implement.  The crafting system is deep and useful at pretty much all levels, mounts are available immediately because of the size of the world, and the world itself feels quite dynamic, even in towns.  A cash shop does exist, but it is not pay-to-win at all since it provides only vanity items or other items / unlocks which you could earn naturally through the game, either by buying with credits or completing requisite criteria.  The contentious unlock from what I have seen is advanced classes (an engineer can become a bastion, for example), which you would normally unlock by levelling a core class to level 40.  However you obtain it, you still start that advanced class at level one like everyone else, though.Some obvious faults which you notice within a few hours of playing:-You are let loose into the world immediately, and if you do not adhere to the loose tutorial to learn fundamentals, you may very well feel like there is just so much going on with so little explanation.  Because the world allows you to stray from the tutorial, you probably will, and you will miss out on very important mechanic information as a result if this happens.  I ended up going back with a higher-level character to do it just to learn some basics which I missed.-This huge world is divided into also huge sections.  There does not seem to be quick travelling by default from within one large zone.  If you expect a hearthstone or something similar from other MMOs, you do not start with it; there is also no guidance on how to come across one from in-game tutorials.  It does exist, but it is not a right.-There is an inconsistency with many in-game models and their dialogue picture counterparts, where the models end up looking nothing like who is supposed to be speaking to you over your communication unit.-You may run into an endless "loading next objective" wall when doing job board missions.  Sometimes it resolves itself in five minutes or so, sometimes it does not.  Exiting the client has not resolved it for me before, so I have found that in this instance, go do other world events in the mean time.  Maybe it will resolve itself.  Since most of the game's story comes from job boards, you may see why this is a problem if you wish to follow the story.-Some objectives for world events do not update properly on your screen.  This is most commonly seen with crashed thumpers, where it consistently says that it is 0 / 5 parts needed to repair, no matter how many parts are brought to it.  That event does correctly end when five parts are brought to it, but the progress never shows.  Reloading the UI does not fix this.-Some on-screen effects, such as poison, may also never go away.  This includes the audio to accompany the effect, even when you are not afflicted by the condition.  Reloading the UI also does not fix this.-Load screens can take ages, and this is solely on the developer's end.  No loading in huge areas once you get in, but the loading TO get in can be 5+ minutes at times, sometimes less, since the loading appears to depend on the servers.-No player name filtering...I would prefer not to see idiots named SACK420 and xxTotalxDarknessxx in my game.-Other bugs exist, and from what I understand, the devs are not quick about addressing them.Oh, and the game is 100% free; you are by no means required to pay anything for the full experience unlike other "freemium" games.  This is, to me, the best free-to-play game right now.  It has full voice acting, visuals similar to Sanctum 2, much to see and do, and no entry fee.  The option to give money to the game in support of future content is unobtrusive if you do not care to pay, while such a fee is simultaneously low enough per month to be comparable to any other big MMO's subscription if you do want to contribute.  Just as how I would like to see more class-based games use Firefall's design in being able to switch classes as needed, I also would like to see more subscription-based games having 100% of the content available for free with perks for subscribing which do not skew the game so much in their favour just for paying money.tl;dr There is much content for zero dollars for RPG or FPS enthusiasts.

content:
11, 2014
												Not a well-made game. PROS1. There are jetpacksNuff said.2. The intro present a pretty interesting game (but the excitement dies off when the game starts)The cinematics present a very exciting and cool game, where you get to play cool Battle Frames. However, in order to advance fast, you will see micro-transactions all over the shops, which kills the excitement.CONS1. Some bugs, Monsters follow you almost everywhere. You can lure them until the bases to be killed. Certain quests don't end even after you kill all the monsters. Lag time in between quest objectives, where quests objectives update very slowly.2. Game is emptyPlayer interaction is few and far between. The low server population numbers make the game feel like a solo RPG.3. Low long-distance mobility, Despite the use of jet packs in the game, tranversing over long distances only comes in 2 forms. Buying a bike or gliding over long distances. If you glide, you have to find specific glider points on the map, which tend to be in bases or craft and call in a 1-time glider launcher. The problem with the glider is that it constantly descends and you can only fly a certain distance(~300-500m). If the waypoint you are flying to is 1000m away, you have to trudge along the rest of the journey. If the next way point has no glider point, you'll have to run the whole way.4. Lack of contentThere are only 3 raids available at level 40 which is the level cap. More will be available as the game updates.5. The game is nowhere like the cinematicGameplay differs really far from advertising. Major fail in expectation.

												its dead.do not even try it!its dead.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------old recommend counter from the time it could have been on the way up! :(but it wasnt...-----------------------eh, what to say?i like! :Di have to counter all those bad revirews after 1.6!yes, patch 1.6 did some things i dont agree with (like changing gear, abilities, and wapons to get the PvP to work better), but the following updates adding up to version 1.9+ are going to fix that! i hope ^^ btw.: the old areas are coming back, with higher level cap for us to enjoy! and the crafting i think, yeah, something like that :)its like early access after years of years of beta and release, its constantly changing and evolving. if you dont like change: that game, for now, is NOT for you! try it maybe next year, after... 2.0, but try it! its F2P god dam* it! xDedit: oh! and bikes! you like bikes (chopper)?Firefall has mounts that are diferent than other MMO mounts (horses, things to ride/drive to get around faster)they perform like real bikes, they accelerate, have gears, they crawl up hills, they go fast downhill, you can crash (stop at things, you dont die or get off your bike ^^), jump over ramps, and you CANT jump around with them like a rubber ball or a pogo stick...!!!its one of the things i like most about the game, its crazy i know, but its great! i rly dont want to see any more of those: "riding speed +100% or 150%" things again! 												I played this game in closed beta, it was not bad, but the bugs and server problems killed it for me. Now after the launch the game changed a lot. New zones, a lot of improvements in crafting, leveling and in the storyline. They added the currency exchange so now you can change in game currency for tokens and you can buy every cash shop items without paying. The GM team is nice, they answer to bug reports. We have every second week and weekends some live events and with next big patch they will going to add a new end-game zone in the game.
